# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cancer`
* Variable label: `Any malignancy (C00-D48) / information about past or current neoplasm (benign, in situ, malignant)`
* Variable description: `cancer diagnosis since the last interview`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | no cancer
1        | cancer

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `cancer_age`
* Variable label: `Age of cancer diagnosis`
* Variable description: `Age of each episode of cancer`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "Any malignancy (C00-D48) / information about past or current neoplasm (benign, in situ, malignant)"
ds_label_age <- "Age of cancer diagnosis"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## Korea


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `w01C013` |`w01C014y`|`ybirth`|
|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Whether or not cancer or malignant tumor diagnostic`|`Time that is diagnosed by first(unit : Year)`|`year of birth`|
| **Table name**  | `w01_main_e`| `w01_main_e`|`ybirth`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes; 5 = no` |`continuous`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** |  | `NA` |  |
| **Description** |  |  |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'KLOSA_w1','KLOSA.w01_main_e',variables=list('w01C013','w01C014y'), missings = T)
KLOSA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'KLOSA_w1')
load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/ybirth.RData"))
KLOSA_w1 <- left_join(KLOSA_w1,ybirth,by="id")

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- KLOSA_w1$w01C013
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(KLOSA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(KLOSA_w1, aes(x=factor(w01C013))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- KLOSA_w1$w01C014y
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = names(KLOSA_w1)[3])
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(KLOSA_w1, aes(w01C014y)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(1975,2010)

vbl <- KLOSA_w1$ybirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = names(KLOSA_w1)[3])
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(KLOSA_w1, aes(ybirth)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(1900,1965)

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 5 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

To compute `cancer_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if cancer == 1, cancer_age = w01C014y-ybirth`
* `if cancer == 0, cancer_age = 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
KLOSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=KLOSA_w1$id)
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer <- car::recode(KLOSA_w1$w01C013,"5=0")

# Continuous variable harmonization
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age <- rep(999,length(KLOSA_ds_w1$id))
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age[KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer==1] <- KLOSA_w1$w01C014y[KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer==1] - KLOSA_w1$ybirth[KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer==1]
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age[KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer==1 & KLOSA_w1$w01C014y == -9] <- 998
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age[KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer==0] <- 996

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(KLOSA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(cancer))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(KLOSA_ds_w1, aes(cancer_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(25,85)

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer)
X <- table(KLOSA_w1$w01C013, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- c(X[2:1])
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("5->0","1,3->1")
kable(C)

```

### Wave 3

| **Label** | `Whether or not cancer or malignant tumor diagnostic since previous interview`|`The time when is diagnosed by first(yyyy)`|`year of birth`|

```{r assign w3, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'KLOSA_w3','KLOSA.w03_main_e_spss_albert',variables=list('w03C016','w03C017y'), missings = T)
KLOSA_w3 <- opal.execute(o,'KLOSA_w3')
# The id's in the third wave add a '.0' at the end of the id's at the previous waves. We correct this. Note that gregexpr("\\.0",ids) == nchar(ids)-1
KLOSA_w3$id <- substr(KLOSA_w3$id,1,nchar(KLOSA_w3$id)-2)

KLOSA_w3 <- left_join(KLOSA_w3,ybirth,by="id")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cancer` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 5 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w4}

KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age[KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer == 0] <- 996
KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age[KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer == 1] <- KLOSA_w4$w04C017y[KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer == 1]-KLOSA_w4$ybirth[KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer == 1]
KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age <- car::recode(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age, "NA=999")
```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer, labels = cat_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer) <- ds_label
KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age, labels = cont_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer_age) <- ds_label_age
KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer, labels = cat_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer) <- ds_label
KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer_age <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer_age, labels = cont_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer_age) <- ds_label_age
KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer, labels = cat_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer) <- ds_label
KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer_age <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer_age, labels = cont_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer_age) <- ds_label_age
KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer, labels = cat_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer) <- ds_label
KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age <- labelled(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age, labels = cont_label)
label(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer_age) <- ds_label_age

KLOSA_m_ds_w1 <- KLOSA_ds_w1
KLOSA_m_ds_w1$cancer <- car::recode(KLOSA_m_ds_w1$cancer, "miss_values_vector=NA")
KLOSA_m_ds_w2 <- KLOSA_ds_w2
KLOSA_m_ds_w2$cancer <- car::recode(KLOSA_m_ds_w2$cancer, "miss_values_vector=NA")
KLOSA_m_ds_w3 <- KLOSA_ds_w3
KLOSA_m_ds_w3$cancer <- car::recode(KLOSA_m_ds_w3$cancer, "miss_values_vector=NA")
KLOSA_m_ds_w4 <- KLOSA_ds_w4
KLOSA_m_ds_w4$cancer <- car::recode(KLOSA_m_ds_w4$cancer, "miss_values_vector=NA")


tt <-    frq(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[5] <- frq(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[6] <- frq(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(KLOSA_ds_w1$cancer), length(KLOSA_ds_w2$cancer), length(KLOSA_ds_w3$cancer), length(KLOSA_ds_w4$cancer)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3", "w4")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(KLOSA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","cancer")], KLOSA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","cancer")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, KLOSA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","cancer")], by="id", all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, KLOSA_m_ds_w4[,c("id","cancer")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w3",".w4"), all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2", "w3", "w4")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],dbb[,5],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```



# Quality estimation

* Probably (I have not checked for this variable but for stroke and other), the diagnostic cancer data for individuals which tell in a wave that they have cancer is missing in all the next waves, so the age of diagnostic too. This fact is preserved in the harmonized variable.

```{r save, include=FALSE, echo=F}
l.KLOSA <- list(w1 = KLOSA_ds_w1, w2 = KLOSA_ds_w2, w3 = KLOSA_ds_w3, w4 = KLOSA_ds_w4)

for(index in seq_along(l.KLOSA)){
  cancer <- l.KLOSA[[index]]
  save(cancer, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.KLOSA)[index],"/cancer.RData"))
}
```
